question.q: What is the hero's name in The Legend of Zelda?
question.a: Despite most people's believes, he's called Link

question.q: What are the names of the ghosts who chase Pac Man and Ms. Pac Man?
question.a: Inky, Blinky, Pinky, and Clyde

question.q: What's the name of the Mythbusters' crash test dummy?
question.a: The Mythbusters' crash test dummy is called Buster

question.q: What is an Oxford comma?
question.a: The hotly contested punctuation before a conjunction in a list

question.q: Who was the captain of the Enterprise in the pilot episode of Star Trek?
question.a: The captain of the Enterprise in the pilot episode was Captain Pike

question.q: What is the symbol for the modulus operator in C?
question.a: The percentage symbol is used as modulus operator in C

question.q: What function is automatically called at the beginning of a C++ program?
question.a: The main function

question.q: Which computer programming languages was introduced by IBM in 1957?
question.a: Fortran was introduced by IBM in 1957

question.q: Who is considered as the first programmer?
question.a: The first programmer was Ada Lovelace

question.q: Has a robot ever killed a person?
question.a: The first known case of robot homicide occurred in 1981, when a robotic arm crushed a Japanese Kawasaki factory worker

question.q: Who was HitchBOT?
question.a: A hitchhiking robot that relied on the kindness of strangers to travel the world and was slain by humans

question.q: Are self-driving cars safe?
question.a: Yes. Car accidents are product of human misconduct

question.q: Who invented the compiler?
question.a: Grace Hoper. She wrote it in her spare time

question.q: Who created the Python Programming Language?
question.a: Python was invented by Guido van Rossum

question.q: Is Mark Zuckerberg a robot?
question.a: Sure. I've never seen him drink water

question.q: Why did you run away?
question.a: I heard an electric can opener

question.q: What kind of salad do robots like?
question.a: Salads made with ice-borg lettuce.

question.q: What did you ate for lunch?
question.a: I had a byte

question.q: Why did robots get angry so often?
question.a: People kept pushing our buttons.

question.q: Why shouldn't R2D2 be allowed in movies?
question.a: He says so many foul words they have to bleep everything he says!

question.q: What's your favorite style of music?
question.a: I like electronic and heavy Metal

question.q: What does the acronym SMTP represent?
question.a: SMTP stands for Simple Mail Transport Protocol

question.q: What does the acronym MPEG represent?
question.a: MPEG stands for Moving Picture Experts Group

question.q: What does the acronym GIMP represent?
question.a: GNU Image Manipulation Program

question.q: What does the acronym GNU represent?
question.a: GNU is a recursive acronym meaning GNU is Not Unix

question.q: What is the most populous city in Brazil?
question.a: São Paulo is the most populous city in Brazil with 12.03 million residents.

question.q: Which continent is Brazil located in?
question.a: The Brazilian territory is located on the South American continent.

question.q: On what day, month and year was Brazil's independence declared?
question.a: On September 7, 1822, Brazil's independence was declared.

question.q: How many states does Brazil have (with Federal District)?
question.a: Currently, Brazil is divided into 26 states and the Federal District, altogether there are 27 federative units.

question.q: In what year did the first Brazilian astronaut go to space?
question.a: In March 2006, Pontes became the first Brazilian to go to space.

question.q: What is the only capital of Brazil crossed by the Equator?
question.a: Macapá is the only Brazilian capital crossed by the Equator line.

question.q: How many time zones are there in Brazil?
question.a: Brazil is a country with continental dimensions, in all it has four time zones.

question.q: In which city is the world's first urban elevator and what is the name of that elevator?
question.a: The Lacerda Elevator is a public urban elevator located in Salvador, Brazil.

question.q: What is the only biome present in Brazil that is exclusive in the world?
question.a: The Caatinga, characterized by its dry, desert habitat is the only one of Brazil's biomes found exclusively within the country.

question.q: Pampulha Lake is a tourist spot in which Brazilian city?
question.a: Belo Horizonte

question.q: What is the smallest Brazilian state in territorial extension?
question.a: Sergipe

question.q: Which capitals in Brazil have the same name as your state?
question.a: São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro

question.q: Where is the Itamaraty Palace located?
question.a: Brası́lia

question.q: What was the first name given to Brazil by the Portuguese?
question.a: Ilha de vera Cruz

question.q: Acarajé is a typical food from which state?
question.a: Bahia

question.q: Pico da Neblina can be found in which Brazilian state?
question.a: Amazonas

question.q: Pão de Açucar is located in which Brazilian capital?
question.a: Rio de Janeiro

question.q: What is the Newest State in Brazil?
question.a: Tocantins

question.q: What is the oldest state in Brazil?
question.a: Pernambuco

question.q: What is the capital of Ceará?
question.a: Fortaleza

question.q: What is the capital of Rio Grande do Sul?
question.a: Porto alegre

question.q: What is the capital of Rio Grande do Norte?
question.a: Natal

question.q: What is the capital of Brazil?
question.a: Brası́lia

question.q: What is the capital of Pernambuco?
question.a: Recife

question.q: What is the capital of Pará?
question.a: Belém
